# Draft:Equatorial Guinea–United Kingdom relations

----
}}
Equatorial Guinea–United Kingdom relations are the diplomatic relations between Equatorial Guinea and the United Kingdom. Both nations are members of the United Nations.
History
The United Kingdom established its diplomatic relations with Equatorial Guinea on June 20, 1969.
Sanctions
On July 22, 2021, the United Kingdom sanctioned Equatoguinean vice president Teodoro Nguema Obiang Mangue for misappropriating money. In response, the Equatoguinean ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation announced the closure of the Embassy of Equatorial Guinea in London.
